content.title: ICLR 2018 Workshop Acceptance Decision
content.comment: This paper was invited to the workshop track based on reviews at the main conference.

forumContent.title: Neural Program Search: Solving Programming Tasks from Description and Examples
forumContent.abstract: We present a Neural Program Search, an algorithm to generate programs from natural language description and a small number of input/output examples. The algorithm combines methods from Deep Learning and Program Synthesis fields by designing rich domain-specific language (DSL) and defining efficient search algorithm guided by a Seq2Tree model on it.  To evaluate the quality of the approach we also present a semi-synthetic dataset of descriptions with test examples and corresponding programs.  We show that our algorithm significantly outperforms a sequence-to-sequence model with attention baseline.
forumContent.TL;DR: Program synthesis from natural language description and input / output examples via Tree-Beam Search over Seq2Tree model

content.title: Neural Program Search: Solving Programming Tasks from Description and Examples
content.abstract: We present a Neural Program Search, an algorithm to generate programs from natural language description and a small number of input/output examples. The algorithm combines methods from Deep Learning and Program Synthesis fields by designing rich domain-specific language (DSL) and defining efficient search algorithm guided by a Seq2Tree model on it.  To evaluate the quality of the approach we also present a semi-synthetic dataset of descriptions with test examples and corresponding programs.  We show that our algorithm significantly outperforms a sequence-to-sequence model with attention baseline.
content.TL;DR: Program synthesis from natural language description and input / output examples via Tree-Beam Search over Seq2Tree model

content.title: Neural Program Search: Solving Data Processing Tasks from Description and Examples
content.abstract: We present a Neural Program Search, an algorithm to generate programs from natural language description and a small number of input / output examples. The algorithm combines methods from Deep Learning and Program Synthesis fields by designing rich domain-specific language (DSL) and defining efficient search algorithm guided by a Seq2Tree model on it. To evaluate the quality of the approach we also present a semi-synthetic dataset of descriptions with test examples and corresponding programs. We show that our algorithm significantly outperforms sequence-to-sequence model with attention baseline.
content.TL;DR: Program synthesis from natural language description and input / output examples via Tree-Beam Search over Seq2Tree model
